trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync: Synchronization Service Manager UI | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync: Synchronization Service Manager UI | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Understand the Operations tab in the Synchronization Service Manager for Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: Understand the Operations tab in the Synchronization Service Manager for Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync: Synchronization Service Manager
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync: Synchronization Service Manager

trans-unit.source: Operations
trans-unit.target: Operations

trans-unit.source: Connectors
trans-unit.target: Connectors

trans-unit.source: Metaverse Designer
trans-unit.target: Metaverse Designer

trans-unit.source: Metaverse Search
trans-unit.target: Metaverse Search

trans-unit.source: Sync Service Manager
trans-unit.target: Sync Service Manager

trans-unit.source: The operations tab shows the results from the most recent operations.
trans-unit.target: The operations tab shows the results from the most recent operations.

trans-unit.source: This tab is key to understand and troubleshoot issues.
trans-unit.target: This tab is key to understand and troubleshoot issues.

trans-unit.source: Understand the information visible in the operations tab
trans-unit.target: Understand the information visible in the operations tab

trans-unit.source: The top half shows all runs in a chronical order.
trans-unit.target: The top half shows all runs in a chronical order.

trans-unit.source: By default the operations log will keep information about the last 7 days, but this can be changed with the [scheduler](active-directory-aadconnectsync-feature-scheduler.md).
trans-unit.target: By default the operations log will keep information about the last 7 days, but this can be changed with the [scheduler](active-directory-aadconnectsync-feature-scheduler.md).

trans-unit.source: You want to look for any run which does not show a success status.
trans-unit.target: You want to look for any run which does not show a success status.

trans-unit.source: You can change the sorting by clicking on the headers.
trans-unit.target: You can change the sorting by clicking on the headers.

trans-unit.source: The **Status** column is the most important information and shows the most severe problem for a run.
trans-unit.target: The **Status** column is the most important information and shows the most severe problem for a run.

trans-unit.source: Here is a quick summary of the most common statuses in order of priority to investigate (where * indicate several possible error strings).
trans-unit.target: Here is a quick summary of the most common statuses in order of priority to investigate (where * indicate several possible error strings).

trans-unit.source: Status
trans-unit.target: Status

trans-unit.source: Comment
trans-unit.target: Comment

trans-unit.source: stopped-*
trans-unit.target: stopped-*

trans-unit.source: The run could not complete.
trans-unit.target: The run could not complete.

trans-unit.source: For example if the remote system is down and cannot be contacted.
trans-unit.target: For example if the remote system is down and cannot be contacted.

trans-unit.source: stopped-error-limit
trans-unit.target: stopped-error-limit

trans-unit.source: There are more than 5,000 errors.
trans-unit.target: There are more than 5,000 errors.

trans-unit.source: The run was automatically stopped due to the large number of errors.
trans-unit.target: The run was automatically stopped due to the large number of errors.

trans-unit.source: completed-*-errors
trans-unit.target: completed-*-errors

trans-unit.source: The run completed, but there are errors (fewer than 5,000) which should be investigated.
trans-unit.target: The run completed, but there are errors (fewer than 5,000) which should be investigated.

trans-unit.source: completed-*-warnings
trans-unit.target: completed-*-warnings

trans-unit.source: The run completed, but some data is not in the expected state.
trans-unit.target: The run completed, but some data is not in the expected state.

trans-unit.source: If you have errors, then this is usually only a symptom.
trans-unit.target: If you have errors, then this is usually only a symptom.

trans-unit.source: Until you have addressed errors, you should not investigate warnings.
trans-unit.target: Until you have addressed errors, you should not investigate warnings.

trans-unit.source: success
trans-unit.target: success

trans-unit.source: No issues.
trans-unit.target: No issues.

trans-unit.source: When you select a row, the bottom will update to show the details of that run.
trans-unit.target: When you select a row, the bottom will update to show the details of that run.

trans-unit.source: To the far left of the bottom you might have a list saying **Step #**.
trans-unit.target: To the far left of the bottom you might have a list saying **Step #**.

trans-unit.source: This will only appear if you have multiple domains in your forest where each domain is represented by a step.
trans-unit.target: This will only appear if you have multiple domains in your forest where each domain is represented by a step.

trans-unit.source: The domain name can be found under the heading **Partition**.
trans-unit.target: The domain name can be found under the heading **Partition**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Synchronization Statistics** you can find more information about the number of changes which were processed.
trans-unit.target: Under **Synchronization Statistics** you can find more information about the number of changes which were processed.

trans-unit.source: You can click on the links to get a list of the changed objects.
trans-unit.target: You can click on the links to get a list of the changed objects.

trans-unit.source: If you have objects with an error, those will show up under **Synchronization Errors**.
trans-unit.target: If you have objects with an error, those will show up under **Synchronization Errors**.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot errors in operations tab
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot errors in operations tab

trans-unit.source: Sync Service Manager
trans-unit.target: Sync Service Manager

trans-unit.source: When you have errors, both the object in error and the error itself are links which will provide more information.
trans-unit.target: When you have errors, both the object in error and the error itself are links which will provide more information.

trans-unit.source: Start by clicking on the error string (in the picture above **sync-rule-error-function-triggered**).
trans-unit.target: Start by clicking on the error string (in the picture above **sync-rule-error-function-triggered**).

trans-unit.source: You will first be presented with an overview of the object.
trans-unit.target: You will first be presented with an overview of the object.

trans-unit.source: To see the actual error, click on the button **Stack Trace**.
trans-unit.target: To see the actual error, click on the button **Stack Trace**.

trans-unit.source: This will provide debug level information for the error.
trans-unit.target: This will provide debug level information for the error.

trans-unit.source: **TIP:** You can right-click in the **call stack information** box, choose **select all**, and **copy**.
trans-unit.target: **TIP:** You can right-click in the **call stack information** box, choose **select all**, and **copy**.

trans-unit.source: You can then copy the stack and look at the error in your favorite editor, such as Notepad.
trans-unit.target: You can then copy the stack and look at the error in your favorite editor, such as Notepad.

trans-unit.source: If the error is from **SyncRulesEngine** then the call stack information will first have a list of all attributes on the object.
trans-unit.target: If the error is from **SyncRulesEngine** then the call stack information will first have a list of all attributes on the object.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down until you see the heading **InnerException =>**.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down until you see the heading **InnerException =>**.

trans-unit.source: ![Sync Service Manager](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-service-manager-ui/errorinnerexception.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Sync Service Manager](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-service-manager-ui/errorinnerexception.png)

trans-unit.source: The line after will show the error.
trans-unit.target: The line after will show the error.

trans-unit.source: In the picture above the error is from a custom Sync Rule Fabrikam created.
trans-unit.target: In the picture above the error is from a custom Sync Rule Fabrikam created.

trans-unit.source: If the error itself does not give enough information, then it is time to look at the data itself.
trans-unit.target: If the error itself does not give enough information, then it is time to look at the data itself.

trans-unit.source: You can click on the link with the object identifier and [Follow an object and its data through the system](active-directory-aadconnectsync-service-manager-ui-connectors.md#follow-an-object-and-its-data-through-the-system).
trans-unit.target: You can click on the link with the object identifier and [Follow an object and its data through the system](active-directory-aadconnectsync-service-manager-ui-connectors.md#follow-an-object-and-its-data-through-the-system).

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn more about the [Azure AD Connect sync](active-directory-aadconnectsync-whatis.md) configuration.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about the [Azure AD Connect sync](active-directory-aadconnectsync-whatis.md) configuration.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
